trans-unit.source: We have added a new parameter to the `Import-DscResource` dynamic keyword available when authoring DSC configurations.
trans-unit.target: We have added a new parameter to the `Import-DscResource` dynamic keyword available when authoring DSC configurations.

trans-unit.source: Configuration authors can now specify exactly which module version to load the DSC resources from.
trans-unit.target: Configuration authors can now specify exactly which module version to load the DSC resources from.

trans-unit.source: The new syntax of the keyword is:
trans-unit.target: The new syntax of the keyword is:

trans-unit.source: **Name**: Names of one or more reosurces to import.
trans-unit.target: **Name**: Names of one or more reosurces to import.

trans-unit.source: **ModuleName**: Module names or ModuleSpecification objects of one or more modules to import.
trans-unit.target: **ModuleName**: Module names or ModuleSpecification objects of one or more modules to import.

trans-unit.source: If used, ModuleName must represent only one module by name.
trans-unit.target: If used, ModuleName must represent only one module by name.

trans-unit.source: In the Windows PowerShell ISE, it shows up with IntelliSense:
trans-unit.target: In the Windows PowerShell ISE, it shows up with IntelliSense:

trans-unit.source: **Note**: the `–ModuleVersion` parameter can only be used in combination with the `–ModuleName` parameter.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: the `–ModuleVersion` parameter can only be used in combination with the `–ModuleName` parameter.

trans-unit.source: It cannot be used with resource names using only the `–Name` parameter.
trans-unit.target: It cannot be used with resource names using only the `–Name` parameter.

trans-unit.source: Before this, the only way to specify the module version when loading DSC resources was by using the Module specification object e.g.: `–ModuleName @{ModuleName="UserConfigProvider";ModuleVersion="3.0"}`
trans-unit.target: Before this, the only way to specify the module version when loading DSC resources was by using the Module specification object e.g.: `–ModuleName @{ModuleName="UserConfigProvider";ModuleVersion="3.0"}`
